ygData.subject: Re: I know...
ygData.msgSnippet: ... In general I would agree with you but bear in mind this.  There are probably no more than a couple of dozen serious tinkerers.  Heck gnomes themselves are
ygData.messageBody:
Aaron Bolch wrote:
>
> From: "Aaron Bolch" <aaronbolch@...>
>
> >From: "Joshua Bednarz" <thewhitemage@...>
> NOTHING on Everquest remains a secret, PERIOD. With over 100,000 active
> players, and a very finite world size, there is just no way anyone can keep
> anything hidden from the rest of the playerbase for long periods of time. A

In general I would agree with you but bear in mind this. There are
probably
no more than a couple of dozen serious tinkerers. Heck gnomes
themselves are
very rare. I see very few as compared to elves or humans.

With such a small population, it IS possible for the secret to be held.
Even more so when all the other things you get from tinkering are useful
to practically no one.

> other "amazing" tinker inventions, I have yet to find a reasonable use for
> it that can't be duplicated by store-bought items or mob drops.
>
> flameless lantern = crappy lightstone
> compass = store-bought compass and trivial to everyone
> firewater = component for random junk and trivial to everyone
> mechanized lockpicks = how many locks have you seen?
> thermal cloak = who's gonna wear it?
> animated bait = who fishes as a profession?

Yes. All this is all the more reason to believe the secret may be known
but
just hidden.


>
> cams = useful!

Really? I keep on asking for fletchers if they want it and never got a
reply.

> spyglass = useful?

Apparently wizards have a spell that does the same thing.

> collapsible fishing pole = the reason for this list

Useful?? Who the hell fishes anymore. I can get free food from
clerics, mages,
rangers, druids... Its use is only as a component, much like firewater.

>
> I have missed some stuff, and obviously tinkered things exist out there that
> we haven't seen yet (like the recently-introduced bait).

I made a trip through akanon asking everyone about tinkering and fishing
poles
and looking at every merchant. Couldn't find anything.


> I would be very upset if that "third book" resided in an area that made it
> difficult, if not impossible, for tinkers below level 35 to attain.

As an aside, I heard from a post either here or on a WWW site that one
of the
files contains the text aqua-lung. Could this be another tinkering
item?
It certainly sounds so.

---ralph
